YouTube found this for me and as someone who has been a handspinner (but isn't currently) I thought it would be worth a watch. Now that I've seen it I can say - I found this very confusing, so confusing that it's hard to explain. A couple things: cashmere comes from goats but this fabric looks like wool, which comes from sheep; I can't see cashmere, which is quite expensive and more of a luxury item, being made into fabric like this (sweaters and scarves yes; suiting no). And some of what was called thread here was actually unspun fiber (including that stuff that was going into a dyepot). I'm not sure this process was shown in order. Maybe it doesn't matter; this is supposed to give a general idea, and it's not like it's for a class, with a test later on. I just wish it was clearer.
